text:
This seems to be a regression in 1.3.
I registered my custom ResourceResolverSpi implementation using 
ResourceResolver.registerAtStart method.
Signing now raises a class cast exception, trace follows:
---------------------------------------------------------
                        java.lang.ClassCastException
	at org.apache.xml.security.utils.resolver.ResourceResolver.getInstance
(ResourceResolver.java:104)
	at org.apache.xml.security.utils.resolver.ResourceResolver.getInstance
(ResourceResolver.java:160)
	at 
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.getContentsBeforeTransformation
(Reference.java:378)
	at 
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.dereferenceURIandPerformTransforms
(Reference.java:602)
	at org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.calculateDigest
(Reference.java:688)
	at org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.generateDigestValue
(Reference.java:354)
	at org.apache.xml.security.signature.Manifest.generateDigestValues
(Manifest.java:183)
	at org.apache.xml.security.signature.XMLSignature.sign
(XMLSignature.java:498)
---------------------------------------------------------

At run-time the resolver instance is of type ResourceResolverSpi but attempt 
is being made to cast it to ResourceResolverSpi.
creator: vmahajan@amberpoint.com

text: Fixed and added unit test to ensure functionality won't be broken again.
creator: sean.mullan@oracle.com
